attributes.action: stop giving British taxpayers' money to overseas projects and spend it on UK citizens.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We want money currently allocated to the Department for International Development (DFID) to be spent in the UK on UK citizens, not overseas.  

DFID has spent approximately £1,501,672,860,500 since 1997 on overseas projects, such as funding democracy in Ukraine and providing legal aid for land rights in Tajikistan! According to DFID, only 0.15% of the UK public has an overwhelming desire to fund projects overseas, which indicates that 99.85% of the UK public do not want taxpayers’ money spent overseas!

As UK taxpayers, we want our money to be allocated to the people of the UK not people in foreign countries.
